Mahasiswa di Bali Tewas Tenggelam di Kolam Renang Hotel
05 Nov 2019, 20:30 by Aditya Mardiastuti
Denpasar - Stepanus Lende (20) ditemukan tewas tenggelam di kolam renang di sebuah hotel di Jl Hayam Wuruk, Denpasar, Bali. Diduga mahasiswa asal Sumba itu tewas diduga karena tidak bisa berenang.
"Motif korban meningggal dunia akibat tenggelam sehubungan korban kurang bisa berenang," kata Kapolsek Denpasar Timur Kompol I Nyoman Karang Adiputra kepada wartawan di Denpasar, Bali, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Peristiwa itu terjadi siang tadi sekitar pukul 13.00 Wita. Kala itu korban bersama dua orang temannya berenang di hotel tanpa izin pihak manajemen.
"Menurut saksi marketing hotel, korban bersama teman-temannya (orang timur) sering berenang di kolam Orenjee Hotel tanpa izin, dan begitu dihampiri oleh karyawan selalu lari," terangnya.
Sementara itu, menurut keterangan teman korban, Maksi, saat mengarah di kedalaman 2 meter korban mulai tenggelam. Korban juga sempat ditolong tapi sudah tidak sadarkan diri.
"Sekembalinya saksi dari depan korban sudah tidak sadarkan diri. Sekitar pukul 14.00 Wita tim pusdalops BPBD Provinsi Bali tiba dan berusaha melakukan tindakan pertolongan Pertama selama 20 menit, namun tidak berhasil dan korban sudah dinyatakan meninggal dunia," terang Nyoman.
Saat ini jenazah korban sudah dievakuasi ke RSUP Sanglah.

Students in Bali Drown in the Hotel Swimming Pool
05 Nov 2019, 20:30 by Aditya Mardiastuti
Denpasar - Stepanus Lende (20) was found drowned dead in a swimming pool in a hotel on Jl Hayam Wuruk, Denpasar, Bali. It is suspected that the student from Sumba was killed because he could not swim.
"The motive of the victim died due to drowning due to the lack of ability to swim," East Denpasar Police Chief Commissioner I Nyoman Karang Adiputra told reporters in Denpasar, Bali, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
The incident occurred this afternoon around 1:00 pm. At that time the victim along with two friends swam in the hotel without permission from the management.
"According to hotel marketing witnesses, the victim along with her friends (easterners) often swim in the Orenjee Hotel pool without permission, and so approached by employees always run away," he explained.
Meanwhile, according to the testimony of the victim's friend, Maksi, when he headed at a depth of 2 meters the victim began to sink. The victim was also helped but was unconscious.
"Upon returning the witness from the front of the victim was unconscious. Around 2:00 pm the Bali Provincial BPBD Pusdalops team arrived and tried to take the First Aid action for 20 minutes, but was unsuccessful and the victim was declared dead," Nyoman explained.
At present the bodies of the victims have been evacuated to Sanglah Hospital.
